title: Kidney Failure Risk Calculator (4-Variable)
description: Predicts progression to kidney failure (dialysis or transplantation) in patients with CKD stages 3-5 using age, sex, eGFR, and urine albumin/creatinine ratio. Validated in over 700,000 individuals across 30+ countries.

parameters.name: egfr
parameters.description: Estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) in mL/min/1.73 m². Calculator is validated for CKD stages 3-5 (eGFR <60)

parameters.name: urine_acr
parameters.description: Urine albumin-to-creatinine ratio (ACR) in mg/g. Can also use mg/mmol by multiplying by 8.84

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: Geographic region for calibration. Non-North American cohorts have different calibration factors

result.name: kidney_failure_risk
result.description: 2-year and 5-year risk of kidney failure requiring dialysis or transplantation

references: Tangri N, Stevens LA, Griffith J, Tighiouart H, Djurdjev O, Naimark D, et al. A predictive model for progression of chronic kidney disease to kidney failure. JAMA. 2011;305(15):1553-9.
Tangri N, Grams ME, Levey AS, Coresh J, Appel LJ, Astor BC, et al. Multinational Assessment of Accuracy of Equations for Predicting Risk of Kidney Failure: A Meta-analysis. JAMA. 2016;315(2):164-74.
Ramspek CL, de Jong Y, Dekker FW, van Diepen M. Towards the best kidney failure prediction tool: a systematic review and selection aid. Nephrol Dial Transplant. 2020;35(9):1527-1538.

Major RW, Shepherd D, Medcalf JF, Xu G, Gray LJ, Brunskill NJ. The Kidney Failure Risk Equation for prediction of end stage renal disease in UK primary care: An external validation and clinical impact projection cohort study. PLoS Med. 2019;16(11):e1002955.
notes: Validated for CKD stages 3-5 (eGFR <60 mL/min/1.73 m²)
Most accurate kidney failure prediction tool, validated in >700,000 individuals across 30+ countries
Used for nephrology referral triage, dialysis planning, and transplant timing
2-year risk >5% or 5-year risk >15% often triggers nephrology referral
Missing ACR is common; imputation or using PCR (protein-to-creatinine ratio) may be considered
8-variable equation available for more detailed assessment including albumin, phosphorus, bicarbonate, and calcium
Calibration differs between North American and non-North American populations
Not validated for acute kidney injury or rapidly progressive glomerulonephritis
